original_title: Sri Lanka, Bangladesh Business Council launched
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka – Bangladesh Business Council (SBBC) aims to boost trade investment and tourism ties between the country, the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce said.
It is the 21st bilateral trade council established by the Chamber.

The High Commissioner of Bangladesh to Sri Lanka Tareq Md Ariful Islam said the launch of the Council would “promote business, trade, and investment between the two neighboring countries,” a statement by the chamber said.

He highlighted the potential that Bangladesh holds as one of the fastest-growing economies globally, offering a huge market, investment-friendly policies, robust infrastructure, a skilled workforce, and rapid digitalization.

The Sri Lanka – Bangladesh Business Council aims to serve as a platform for businesses from Sri Lanka and Bangladesh to collaborate, explore opportunities for mutual growth, and promote trade, tourism, and investments between the two countries. (Colombo/Nov20/2023)
